title: Bending the universe in your favor | Claire Vo (LaunchDarkly, Color, Optimizely, ChatPRD)
key_insights: Know what you want in your career, be clear about it, and make it easy for your boss to help you get there by solving company problems
Set expectations one click faster - if something needs to be done this year, do it this half; this quarter, this month
The universe is bendable to your will - organizations are fluid and can be reorganized around talented, motivated individuals
Clear feedback is kind - conflict-avoidant cultures degrade talent bars and don't help people succeed
AI will likely replace lowercase 'c' communication (functional information trading) but not capital 'C' communication (influence, boldness, charisma)
CPTO roles combining product and engineering work when you have a leader who can optimize for the whole organization rather than individual functions
Focus on your zone of genius - where you're exceptional, where no one else can do the job as well, and where you derive joy
topics_discussed: Career progression from APM to CPO
Asking for promotions and career growth
Creating fast-paced culture in larger companies
Setting high talent and product quality bars
Women in tech experiences and challenges
CPTO role combining product and engineering
AI impact on product management skills
memorable_quotes: The universe is bendable to your will - organizations are very fluid and I like to organize around talented motivated individuals
Clear is kind - conflict-avoidant, feedback-avoidant cultures degrade the talent bar
Fast beats right - when debating between noodling for a thousand years vs making a decision and executing, fast consistently wins
recommended_for: engineering managers transitioning to broader roles
professionals interested in AI's impact on PM work
summary: Claire Vo shares her journey from APM to CPO across multiple companies, offering tactical advice on career advancement, building high-performance teams, and navigating the changing landscape of product management with AI. She emphasizes taking agency over your career, bending organizations around talent, and maintaining both speed and quality in execution.
